employee_external_id.notes: Direct mapping - Oracle PersonId represents the employee identifier. Maps to the required PersonId field in Oracle HCM Absences API for creating absence records.

absence_type_external_id.notes: Direct mapping - Oracle AbsenceTypeId represents the absence type identifier. Maps to the required AbsenceTypeId field in Oracle HCM Absences API for creating absence records.

status.notes: Direct mapping - Oracle Status field represents the absence status. Available in AbsenceRecord schema for response data. Note: Status field is response-only in Oracle API (not in POST request body). For requests, consider using AbsenceReason field for status-like information.

start_date.notes: Direct mapping - Oracle StartDate represents the absence start date. Maps to the required StartDate field in Oracle HCM Absences API for creating absence records. Format: date (YYYY-MM-DD).

end_date.notes: Direct mapping - Oracle EndDate represents the absence end date. Maps to the required EndDate field in Oracle HCM Absences API for creating absence records. Format: date (YYYY-MM-DD).

start_half_day.notes: Conversion mapping - Oracle uses StartTime (time format) instead of boolean half_day flag. Business logic needed: if start_half_day=true, set StartTime to '12:00:00', if false, set to '09:00:00' or leave empty for full day.

end_half_day.notes: Conversion mapping - Oracle uses EndTime (time format) instead of boolean half_day flag. Business logic needed: if end_half_day=true, set EndTime to '12:00:00', if false, set to '17:00:00' or leave empty for full day.

amount.notes: Logical mapping - Oracle has separate Days and Hours fields. Business logic needed: if unit='DAYS', map to Days field; if unit='HOURS', map to Hours field. This field represents the numeric quantity of time off.

unit.notes: Logical mapping - Oracle uses separate Days and Hours fields instead of a unit field. Business logic needed: determine which field to populate based on unit value ('DAYS' -> Days field, 'HOURS' -> Hours field).

employee_note.notes: Direct mapping - Oracle Description field represents additional description/notes. Maps to the optional Description field in Oracle HCM Absences API for creating absence records. Alternative mapping available: AbsenceReason field for more specific reason codes.

processing_context: Oracle HCM Absences REST API - Comprehensive field mapping with business logic for time-based conversions and unit handling

mapping_summary.field_matching_quality: Excellent - All fields successfully mapped with appropriate business logic

business_logic_notes.start_half_day_conversion: Convert boolean half_day flag to time format: true -> '12:00:00', false -> '09:00:00' or empty for full day
business_logic_notes.end_half_day_conversion: Convert boolean half_day flag to time format: true -> '12:00:00', false -> '17:00:00' or empty for full day
business_logic_notes.amount_unit_logic: Route amount to Days or Hours field based on unit value: 'DAYS' -> Days field, 'HOURS' -> Hours field
business_logic_notes.status_handling: Status field only available in response schema, not in POST request body. Consider using AbsenceReason for status-like information in requests.
business_logic_notes.employee_note_alternatives: employee_note can be mapped to either Description (general notes) or AbsenceReason (specific reason codes) based on business requirements.
